item.title: carla unreal4 compile and run in linux
item.description:
build CARLA on Linux

First step is to install build tools, dependency and enable clang 6.0 and LLVM’s libc++ for building unreal engine 4. The following codes are used as reference, please refer to the original carla document.

sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install wget software-properties-common
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:ubuntu-toolchain-r/test
wget -O - https://apt.llvm.org/llvm-snapshot.gpg.key|sudo apt-key add -
sudo apt-add-repository "deb http://apt.llvm.org/xenial/ llvm-toolchain-xenial-7 main"
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install build-essential clang-7 lld-7 g++-7 cmake ninja-build libvulkan1 python python-pip python-dev python3-dev python3-pip libpng-dev libtiff5-dev libjpeg-dev tzdata sed curl unzip autoconf libtool rsync
pip3 install --user setuptools

sudo update-alternatives --install /usr/bin/clang++ clang++ /usr/lib/llvm-7/bin/clang++ 170
sudo update-alternatives --install /usr/bin/clang clang /usr/lib/llvm-7/bin/clang 170

Build Unreal Engine

The next step is to build the unreal engine on local machine, get clone from UE4 github repository then go the folder and run

git clone --depth=1 -b 4.22 https://github.com/EpicGames/UnrealEngine.git ~/UnrealEngine_4.22
cd ~/UnrealEngine_4.22
./Setup.sh && ./GenerateProjectFiles.sh && make

Note: It must be the version 4.22, otherwise you will get Carla build error sometime later @make launch phase.

Build CARLA

to build carla we need to clone carla first, it’s preferred to use the stable brache. Optionally download aria2 will run quite faster. By calling ./Update.sh it will download the asset packages, which takes approx. 6.8 GBytes.

In order to find the Unreal Engine’s folder we need to define the environment variable UE4_ROOT, e.g. in .bashrc. After setting up the enviroment label we could compile the simulator and launch Unreal Engine Editor.

git clone https://github.com/carla-simulator/carla.git
sudo apt-get install aria2
cd carla
export UE4_ROOT=~/UnrealEngine_4.22
./Update.sh

It shall be noted that UE4 requires vulkan driver by default, but to my experience vulkan is not stable using Nvidia card. Personly speaking, I would like to change back to openGL by setting:

  1. Go to ~/carla/Util/BuildTools/BuildCarlaUE4.sh
  2. Open it and change RHI=“-vulkan” to RHI=“-opengl”

I have also tried with AMD card, vulkan is working fine. To install driver it has to be identified which GPU is installed on system. For AMD GPU it’s best to enable a PPA for the latest Mesa drivers. please refers to vulkan.

sudo dpkg --add-architecture i386 #enable 32bit architecture
lspci | grep VGA #check which GPU you have in system
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:oibaf/graphics-drivers
sudo apt update
sudo apt upgrade
sudo apt install libvulkan1 mesa-vulkan-drivers vulkan-utils #for AMD card using vulkan is fine

#for Nvidia card, driver shall be installed by downloading from Nvidia webpage for the latest version. vulkan is not required because I changed BuildCarlaEU4.sh to -opengl
reboot

Install Nvidia driver in Ubuntu is a little tricky. First, we need to download the latest driver from Nvidia webpage, then install the driver without X server. following bash commands are for reference.

# Ctrl + Alt + F2 go to console login
chmod +x ./your-nvidia-file.run #in my case NVIDIA-Linux_x86_64-440.36.run
sudo ./NVIDIA-Linux_x86_64-440.36.run
reboot

After reboot, using nvidia-smi to check the driver version.

Finally, we can use make to run different commands and build the different modules, like

make launch     # Compiles the simulator and launches Unreal Engine's Editor.
make PythonAPI  # Compiles the PythonAPI module necessary for running the Python examples.
make package    # Compiles everything and creates a packaged version able to run without UE4 editor.
make help       # Print all available commands.
